data.title: Excellent Beer Selection
data.text: What's not to like about 24 revolving taps?  Most brews are from the central valley area (as well as Altamont Beer Works in Livermore), and they carry a few Bud lights for non-craft-brew fans.  While B&H is not offering any food items at this time, you are welcome to bring your own snacks.  Prices per pint (or are 12 oz pours) were a tad high...($8-$10 each)

data.title: Great New Tasting Room
data.text:
Opened in late April '16 this new tasting bar is sure to be a downtown Lodi success! 

B&H features 3 local wineries: Oak Farm, McCay, and Prie. Both Oak Farm & McCay are wonderful wineries with a solid reputation. Prie is a newer place with outstanding wines as well.

B&H offers 24 rotating craft ber taps, the most in Lodi-Woodbridge. A good selection of different breweries from all over the west coast with an emphasis on Sacramento & the Bay Area. A few from OR, WA, and SoCal. They also had a lot of styles of beers: Pils, Ambers, IPA, DIPA, Porter, Stout, Wheat, etc.

No food service but they have partnered with Raley's to sell Deli Plates of fresh fruit, cheese, meat, crackers, etc. They looked really good.

Prices are a bit higher than other spots in downtown Lodi but well worth it. No loud music, acoustics are good so noise does not bounce around the space, and it is upscale. Target demographics are definitely 35+ (read as: no drunk 20-somethings).

Owners, a husband & wife team, were super friendly as was the waitress. Nice tables & stools, and tasteful wall decor. More wine bar than beer joint for sure.
